page.title: 04Historic Settlements
page.content: There is a concentration of medieval moated sites in this area.They possibly date from a period in the 12th and 13th centuries when farmers were moving from the main villages and setting up new farmsteads. There are over 13 such sites in this area.Some are 2 sided moats, others triangular and some completely enclose a central area.Many have lost their original farmstead and others have been destroyed and ploughed in. Examples can be found at Eyreswood Farm - the moat has now been filled in but did enclose a central area;Bourne End Farm, Wootton - which has a deep moat,is possibly 12th century and a defensive site and Moat Farm, Cranfield with its many old closes.
